headers.mt1: The First Book of the Chronicles

verses.text: Adam, Sheth, Enosh,
Kenan, Mahalaleel, Jered,
Henoch, Methuselah, Lamech,
Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

¶ The sons of Japheth; Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan,
and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.

And the sons of Gomer; Ashchenaz, and Riphath, and Togarmah.\f + \fr 1.6 
\ft Riphath: or, Diphath as it is in some copies\f*

And the sons of Javan; Elishah, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.\f + \fr 1.7 
\ft Dodanim: or, Rodanim, according to some copies\f*
¶ The sons of Ham; Cush, and Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

And the sons of Cush; Seba, and Havilah, and Sabta, and Raamah,
and Sabtecha. And the sons of Raamah; Sheba, and Dedan.
And Cush begat Nimrod: he began to be mighty upon the earth.
And Mizraim begat Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,

And Pathrusim, and Casluhim, (of whom came the Philistines,)
and Caphthorim.
And Canaan begat Zidon his firstborn, and Heth,
The Jebusite also, and the Amorite, and the Girgashite,
And the Hivite, and the Arkite, and the Sinite,
And the Arvadite, and the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.

¶ The sons of Shem; Elam, and Asshur, and Arphaxad, and Lud,
and Aram, and Uz, and Hul, and Gether, and Meshech.\f + \fr 1.17 
\ft Meshech: or, Mash\f*
And Arphaxad begat Shelah, and Shelah begat Eber.

And unto Eber were born two sons: the name of the one \add was\add*
Peleg; because in his days the earth was divided: and his brother’s
name \add was\add* Joktan.\f + \fr 1.19  \ft Peleg: that is, division\f*

And Joktan begat Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and
Jerah,
Hadoram also, and Uzal, and Diklah,

And Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab. All these \add were\add*
the sons of Joktan.
¶ Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,
Eber, Peleg, Reu,
Serug, Nahor, Terah,
Abram; the same \add is\add* Abraham.
The sons of Abraham; Isaac, and Ishmael.

¶ These \add are\add* their generations: The firstborn of Ishmael,
Nebaioth; then Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,

Mishma, and Dumah, Massa, Hadad, and Tema,\f + \fr 1.30  \ft Hadad: also called,
Hadar\f*
Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.

¶ Now the sons of Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: she bare Zimran,
and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah. And the
sons of Jokshan; Sheba, and Dedan.

And the sons of Midian; Ephah, and Epher, and Henoch, and
Abida, and Eldaah. All these \add are\add* the sons of Keturah.
And Abraham begat Isaac. The sons of Isaac; Esau and Israel.

¶ The sons of Esau; Eliphaz, Reuel, and Jeush, and Jaalam,
and Korah.

The sons of Eliphaz; Teman, and Omar, Zephi, and Gatam, Kenaz,
and Timna, and Amalek.\f + \fr 1.36  \ft Zephi: or, Zepho\f*
The sons of Reuel; Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.

And the sons of Seir; Lotan, and Shobal, and Zibeon, and Anah,
and Dishon, and Ezer, and Dishan.

And the sons of Lotan; Hori, and Homam: and Timna \add was\add*
Lotan’s sister.\f + \fr 1.39  \ft Homam: or, Hemam\f*

The sons of Shobal; Alian, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shephi,
and Onam. And the sons of Zibeon; Aiah, and Anah.\f + \fr 1.40  \ft Alian: also called,
Alvan\f*\f + \fr 1.40  \ft Shephi: also called, Shepho\f*

The sons of Anah; Dishon. And the sons of Dishon; Amram, and
Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran.\f + \fr 1.41  \ft Amram: or, Hemdan\f*

The sons of Ezer; Bilhan, and Zavan, \add and\add* Jakan.
The sons of Dishan; Uz, and Aran.\f + \fr 1.42  \ft Jakan: or, Akan\f*
And when Bela was dead, Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his stead.

And when Jobab was dead, Husham of the land of the Temanites
reigned in his stead.

And when Husham was dead, Hadad the son of Bedad, which smote
Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead: and the name of his
city \add was\add* Avith.
And when Hadad was dead, Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his stead.
And when Samlah was dead, Shaul of Rehoboth by the river reigned in his stead.
And when Shaul was dead, Baal-hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his stead.

And when Baal-hanan was dead, Hadad reigned in his stead: and the
name of his city \add was\add* Pai; and his wife’s name \add was\add*
Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.\f + \fr 1.50 
\ft Hadad: or, Hadar\f*\f + \fr 1.50  \ft Pai: or, Pau\f*

¶ Hadad died also. And the dukes of Edom were; duke Timnah,
duke Aliah, duke Jetheth,
Duke Kenaz, duke Teman, duke Mibzar,

Duke Magdiel, duke Iram. These \add are\add* the dukes of
Edom.

These \add are\add* the sons of Israel; Reuben, Simeon, Levi,
and Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun,\f + \fr 2.1  \ft Israel: or, Jacob\f*
Dan, Joseph, and Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.

¶ The sons of Judah; Er, and Onan, and Shelah: \add which\add*
three were born unto him of the daughter of Shua the Canaanitess.
And Er, the firstborn of Judah, was evil in the sight of the \nd LORD\nd*;
and he slew him.

And Tamar his daughter in law bare him Pharez and Zerah. All the
sons of Judah \add were\add* five.
The sons of Pharez; Hezron, and Hamul.

And the sons of Zerah; Zimri, and Ethan, and Heman, and Calcol,
and Dara: five of them in all.\f + \fr 2.6  \ft Zimri: or, Zabdi\f*\f + \fr 2.6 
\ft Dara: or, Darda\f*

And the sons of Carmi; Achar, the troubler of Israel, who transgressed
in the thing accursed.\f + \fr 2.7  \ft Achar: or, Achan\f*
And the sons of Ethan; Azariah.

The sons also of Hezron, that were born unto him; Jerahmeel,
and Ram, and Chelubai.\f + \fr 2.9  \ft Ram: Gr. Aram\f*\f + \fr 2.9 
\ft Chelubai: or, Caleb\f*

And Ram begat Amminadab; and Amminadab begat Nahshon, prince
of the children of Judah;

And Nahshon begat Salma, and Salma begat Boaz,\f + \fr 2.11 
\ft Salma: also called, Salmon\f*
And Boaz begat Obed, and Obed begat Jesse,

¶ And Jesse begat his firstborn Eliab, and Abinadab the second,
and Shimma the third,\f + \fr 2.13  \ft Shimma: or, Shammah\f*
Nethaneel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,
Ozem the sixth, David the seventh:

Whose sisters \add were\add* Zeruiah, and Abigail. And the
sons of Zeruiah; Abishai, and Joab, and Asahel, three.

And Abigail bare Amasa: and the father of Amasa \add was\add*
Jether the Ishmeelite.\f + \fr 2.17  \ft Jether…: also called, Ithra an
Israelite\f*

And when Azubah was dead, Caleb took unto him Ephrath, which
bare him Hur.
And Hur begat Uri, and Uri begat Bezaleel.

¶ And afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir the
father of Gilead, whom he married when he \add was\add* threescore
years old; and she bare him Segub.\f + \fr 2.21  \ft married: Heb.
took\f*

And Segub begat Jair, who had three and twenty cities in the
land of Gilead.

And he took Geshur, and Aram, with the towns of Jair, from them, with
Kenath, and the towns thereof, \add even\add* threescore cities. All these
\add belonged to\add* the sons of Machir the father of Gilead.

And after that Hezron was dead in Caleb-ephratah, then Abiah
Hezron’s wife bare him Ashur the father of Tekoa.

¶ And the sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron were, Ram
the firstborn, and Bunah, and Oren, and Ozem, \add and\add* Ahijah.

Jerahmeel had also another wife, whose name \add was\add*
Atarah; she \add was\add* the mother of Onam.

And the sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel were, Maaz,
and Jamin, and Eker.

And the sons of Onam were, Shammai, and Jada. And the sons
of Shammai; Nadab, and Abishur.

And the name of the wife of Abishur \add was\add* Abihail,
and she bare him Ahban, and Molid.

And the sons of Nadab; Seled, and Appaim: but Seled died without
children.

And the sons of Appaim; Ishi. And the sons of Ishi; Sheshan.
And the children of Sheshan; Ahlai.

And the sons of Jada the brother of Shammai; Jether, and Jonathan:
and Jether died without children.

And the sons of Jonathan; Peleth, and Zaza. These were the
sons of Jerahmeel.

¶ Now Sheshan had no sons, but daughters. And Sheshan had a
servant, an Egyptian, whose name \add was\add* Jarha.

And Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his servant to wife;
and she bare him Attai.
And Attai begat Nathan, and Nathan begat Zabad,
And Obed begat Jehu, and Jehu begat Azariah,
And Azariah begat Helez, and Helez begat Eleasah,
And Eleasah begat Sisamai, and Sisamai begat Shallum,
And Shallum begat Jekamiah, and Jekamiah begat Elishama.

¶ Now the sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel \add were\add*,
Mesha his firstborn, which was the father of Ziph; and the sons of
Mareshah the father of Hebron.

And the sons of Hebron; Korah, and Tappuah, and Rekem, and
Shema.

And Shema begat Raham, the father of Jorkoam: and Rekem begat
Shammai.

And the son of Shammai \add was\add* Maon: and Maon \add was\add*
the father of Beth-zur.

And Ephah, Caleb’s concubine, bare Haran, and Moza, and Gazez:
and Haran begat Gazez.

And the sons of Jahdai; Regem, and Jotham, and Geshan, and
Pelet, and Ephah, and Shaaph.
Maachah, Caleb’s concubine, bare Sheber, and Tirhanah.

She bare also Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father
of Machbenah, and the father of Gibea: and the daughter of Caleb
\add was\add* Achsah.

¶ These were the sons of Caleb the son of Hur, the firstborn
of Ephratah; Shobal the father of Kirjath-jearim,\f + \fr 2.50  \ft Ephratah: also called,
Ephreth\f*
Salma the father of Beth-lehem, Hareph the father of Beth-gader.

And Shobal the father of Kirjath-jearim had sons; Haroeh,
\add and\add* half of the Manahethites.\f + \fr 2.52  \ft Haroeh: or,
Reaiah\f*\f + \fr 2.52  \ft half…: or, half of the Menuchites, or,
Hatsi-ham-menuchoth\f*

And the families of Kirjath-jearim; the Ithrites, and the
Puhites, and the Shumathites, and the Mishraites; of them came the
Zareathites, and the Eshtaulites.

The sons of Salma; Beth-lehem, and the Netophathites, Ataroth,
the house of Joab, and half of the Manahethites, the Zorites.\f + \fr 2.54 
\ft Ataroth…: or, Atarites, or, crowns of the house of Joab\f*

And the families of the scribes which dwelt at Jabez; the
Tirathites, the Shimeathites, \add and\add* Suchathites. These \add are\add*
the Kenites that came of Hemath, the father of the house of Rechab.

Now these were the sons of David, which were born unto him in
Hebron; the firstborn Amnon, of Ahinoam the Jezreelitess; the second
Daniel, of Abigail the Carmelitess:\f + \fr 3.1  \ft Daniel: or,
Chileab\f*

The third, Absalom the son of Maachah the daughter of Talmai
king of Geshur: the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith:

The fifth, Shephatiah of Abital: the sixth, Ithream by Eglah
his wife.

\add These\add* six were born unto him in Hebron; and there he
reigned seven years and six months: and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty
and three years.

And these were born unto him in Jerusalem; Shimea, and Shobab,
and Nathan, and Solomon, four, of Bath-shua the daughter of Ammiel:\f + \fr 3.5 
\ft Shimea: or, Shammua\f*\f + \fr 3.5  \ft Bath-shua: or, Bath-sheba\f*\f + \fr 3.5 
\ft Ammiel: or, Eliam\f*

Ibhar also, and Elishama, and Eliphelet,\f + \fr 3.6  \ft Elishama: also called,
Elishua\f*
And Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,

And Elishama, and Eliada, and Eliphelet, nine.\f + \fr 3.8 
\ft Eliada: or, Beeliada\f*

\add These were\add* all the sons of David, beside the sons
of the concubines, and Tamar their sister.

¶ And Solomon’s son \add was\add* Rehoboam, Abia his son, Asa
his son, Jehoshaphat his son,\f + \fr 3.10  \ft Abia: or, Abijam\f*

Joram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,\f + \fr 3.11 
\ft Ahaziah: or, Azariah\f*

Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,\f + \fr 3.12 
\ft Azariah: or, Uzziah\f*
Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,
Amon his son, Josiah his son.

And the sons of Josiah \add were\add*, the firstborn Johanan,
the second Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, the fourth Shallum.\f + \fr 3.15 
\ft Johanan: or, Jehoahaz\f*\f + \fr 3.15  \ft Jehoiakim: or, Eliakim\f*\f + \fr 3.15 
\ft Zedekiah: or, Mattaniah\f*

And the sons of Jehoiakim: Jeconiah his son, Zedekiah his
son.\f + \fr 3.16  \ft Jeconiah: also called, Jehoiachin or Coniah\f*

¶ And the sons of Jeconiah; Assir, Salathiel his son,\f + \fr 3.17 
\ft Salathiel: Heb. Shealtiel\f*

Malchiram also, and Pedaiah, and Shenazar, Jecamiah, Hoshama,
and Nedabiah.

And the sons of Pedaiah \add were\add*, Zerubbabel, and Shimei:
and the sons of Zerubbabel; Meshullam, and Hananiah, and Shelomith
their sister:

And Hashubah, and Ohel, and Berechiah, and Hasadiah, Jushab-hesed,
five.

And the sons of Hananiah; Pelatiah, and Jesaiah: the sons
of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, the sons of
Shechaniah.

And the sons of Shechaniah; Shemaiah: and the sons of Shemaiah;
Hattush, and Igeal, and Bariah, and Neariah, and Shaphat, six.

And the sons of Neariah; Elioenai, and Hezekiah, and Azrikam,
three.\f + \fr 3.23  \ft Hezekiah: Heb. Hiskijah\f*

And the sons of Elioenai \add were\add*, Hodaiah, and Eliashib,
and Pelaiah, and Akkub, and Johanan, and Dalaiah, and Anani, seven.

The sons of Judah; Pharez, Hezron, and Carmi, and Hur, and
Shobal.\f + \fr 4.1  \ft Carmi: also called, Chelubai or Caleb\f*

And Reaiah the son of Shobal begat Jahath; and Jahath begat
Ahumai, and Lahad. These \add are\add* the families of the Zorathites.\f + \fr 4.2 
\ft Reaiah: or, Haroeh\f*

And these \add were of\add* the father of Etam; Jezreel, and
Ishma, and Idbash: and the name of their sister \add was\add* Hazelelponi:

And Penuel the father of Gedor, and Ezer the father of Hushah. These
\add are\add* the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephratah, the father
of Beth-lehem.
¶ And Ashur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.

And Naarah bare him Ahuzam, and Hepher, and Temeni, and Haahashtari. These
\add were\add* the sons of Naarah.

And the sons of Helah \add were\add*, Zereth, and Jezoar, and
Ethnan.

And Coz begat Anub, and Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel
the son of Harum.

¶ And Jabez was more honourable than his brethren: and his mother
called his name Jabez, saying, Because I bare him with sorrow.\f + \fr 4.9 
\ft Jabez: that is, Sorrowful\f*

And Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, Oh that thou wouldest
bless me indeed, and enlarge my coast, and that thine hand might be with me, and that thou wouldest
keep \add me\add* from evil, that it may not grieve me! And God granted
him that which he requested.\f + \fr 4.10  \ft Oh…: Heb. If thou wilt,
etc\f*\f + \fr 4.10  \ft keep…: Heb. do me\f*

¶ And Chelub the brother of Shuah begat Mehir, which \add was\add*
the father of Eshton.

And Eshton begat Beth-rapha, and Paseah, and Tehinnah the
father of Ir-nahash. These \add are\add* the men of Rechah.\f + \fr 4.12 
\ft Ir-nahash: or, the city of Nahash\f*

And the sons of Kenaz; Othniel, and Seraiah: and the sons
of Othniel; Hathath.\f + \fr 4.13  \ft Hathath…: or, Hathath, and Meonothai, who begat,
etc\f*

And Meonothai begat Ophrah: and Seraiah begat Joab, the father
of the valley of Charashim; for they were craftsmen.\f + \fr 4.14 
\ft valley: or, inhabitants of the valley\f*\f + \fr 4.14  \ft Charashim: that is,
craftsmen\f*\f + \fr 4.14  \ft Hathath…: or, Hathath, and Meonothai, who begat,
etc\f*

And the sons of Caleb the son of Jephunneh; Iru, Elah, and
Naam: and the sons of Elah, even Kenaz.\f + \fr 4.15  \ft even Kenaz: or,
Uknaz\f*
And the sons of Jehaleleel; Ziph, and Ziphah, Tiria, and Asareel.

And the sons of Ezra \add were\add*, Jether, and Mered, and
Epher, and Jalon: and she bare Miriam, and Shammai, and Ishbah the
father of Eshtemoa.

And his wife Jehudijah bare Jered the father of Gedor, and
Heber the father of Socho, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah. And these
\add are\add* the sons of Bithiah the daughter of Pharaoh, which
Mered took.\f + \fr 4.18  \ft Jehudijah: or, the Jewess\f*

And the sons of \add his\add* wife Hodiah the sister of Naham,
the father of Keilah the Garmite, and Eshtemoa the Maachathite.\f + \fr 4.19 
\ft Hodiah: or, Jehudijah, mentioned before\f*

And the sons of Shimon \add were\add*, Amnon, and Rinnah,
Ben-hanan, and Tilon. And the sons of Ishi \add were\add*, Zoheth,
and Ben-zoheth.

¶ The sons of Shelah the son of Judah \add were\add*, Er the
father of Lecah, and Laadah the father of Mareshah, and the families
of the house of them that wrought fine linen, of the house of Ashbea,

And Jokim, and the men of Chozeba, and Joash, and Saraph,
who had the dominion in Moab, and Jashubi-lehem. And \add these are\add*
ancient things.

These \add were\add* the potters, and those that dwelt among
plants and hedges: there they dwelt with the king for his work.

¶ The sons of Simeon \add were\add*, Nemuel, and Jamin, Jarib,
Zerah, \add and\add* Shaul:\f + \fr 4.24  \ft Nemuel: or, Jemuel\f*\f + \fr 4.24 
\ft Jarib, Zerah: or, Jachin Zohar\f*
Shallum his son, Mibsam his son, Mishma his son.

And the sons of Mishma; Hamuel his son, Zacchur his son, Shimei
his son.

And Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters; but his brethren
had not many children, neither did all their family multiply, like to the
children of Judah.\f + \fr 4.27  \ft like…: Heb. unto\f*
And they dwelt at Beer-sheba, and Moladah, and Hazar-shual,

And at Bilhah, and at Ezem, and at Tolad,\f + \fr 4.29  \ft Bilhah: or,
Balah\f*\f + \fr 4.29  \ft Tolad: or, Eltolad\f*
And at Bethuel, and at Hormah, and at Ziklag,

And at Beth-marcaboth, and Hazar-susim, and at Beth-birei,
and at Shaaraim. These \add were\add* their cities unto the reign
of David.\f + \fr 4.31  \ft Hazar-susim: or, Hazar-susah\f*

And their villages \add were\add*, Etam, and Ain, Rimmon,
and Tochen, and Ashan, five cities:\f + \fr 4.32  \ft Etam: or, Ether\f*

And all their villages that \add were\add* round about the same
cities, unto Baal. These \add were\add* their habitations, and their
genealogy.\f + \fr 4.33  \ft Baal: or, Baalath-beer\f*\f + \fr 4.33 
\ft their genealogy: or, as they divided themselves by nations among
them\f*
And Meshobab, and Jamlech, and Joshah the son of Amaziah,

And Joel, and Jehu the son of Josibiah, the son of Seraiah,
the son of Asiel,

And Elioenai, and Jaakobah, and Jeshohaiah, and Asaiah, and
Adiel, and Jesimiel, and Benaiah,

And Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah,
the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah;

These mentioned by \add their\add* names \add were\add* princes
in their families: and the house of their fathers increased greatly.\f + \fr 4.38 
\ft mentioned: Heb. coming\f*

¶ And they went to the entrance of Gedor, \add even\add* unto the east
side of the valley, to seek pasture for their flocks.

And they found fat pasture and good, and the land \add was\add*
wide, and quiet, and peaceable; for \add they\add* of Ham had dwelt
there of old.

And these written by name came in the days of Hezekiah king
of Judah, and smote their tents, and the habitations that were found
there, and destroyed them utterly unto this day, and dwelt in their rooms: because
\add there was\add* pasture there for their flocks.

And \add some\add* of them, \add even\add* of the sons of Simeon,
five hundred men, went to mount Seir, having for their captains Pelatiah,
and Neariah, and Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.

And they smote the rest of the Amalekites that were escaped,
and dwelt there unto this day.

Now the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel, (for he \add was\add*
the firstborn; but, forasmuch as he defiled his father’s bed, his
birthright was given unto the sons of Joseph the son of Israel: and the genealogy is not to be
reckoned after the birthright.

For Judah prevailed above his brethren, and of him \add came\add*
the chief ruler; but the birthright \add was\add* Joseph’s:)\f + \fr 5.2 
\ft chief…: or, prince\f*

The sons, \add I say\add*, of Reuben the firstborn of Israel
\add were\add*, Hanoch, and Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

The sons of Joel; Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his
son,
Micah his son, Reaia his son, Baal his son,

Beerah his son, whom Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria carried
away \add captive:\add* he \add was\add* prince of the Reubenites.\f + \fr 5.6 
\ft Tilgath-pilneser: also called, Tiglath-pileser\f*

And his brethren by their families, when the genealogy of their
generations was reckoned, \add were\add* the chief, Jeiel, and Zechariah,

And Bela the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel,
who dwelt in Aroer, even unto Nebo and Baal-meon:\f + \fr 5.8  \ft Shema: or,
Shemaiah\f*

And eastward he inhabited unto the entering in of the wilderness
from the river Euphrates: because their cattle were multiplied in the
land of Gilead.

And in the days of Saul they made war with the Hagarites,
who fell by their hand: and they dwelt in their tents throughout
all the east \add land\add* of Gilead.\f + \fr 5.10  \ft throughout…: Heb. upon all the face of the
east\f*

¶ And the children of Gad dwelt over against them, in the land
of Bashan unto Salchah:

Joel the chief, and Shapham the next, and Jaanai, and Shaphat
in Bashan.

And their brethren of the house of their fathers \add were\add*,
Michael, and Meshullam, and Sheba, and Jorai, and Jachan, and Zia,
and Heber, seven.

Ahi the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, chief of the house
of their fathers.

And they dwelt in Gilead in Bashan, and in her towns, and in all the
suburbs of Sharon, upon their borders.\f + \fr 5.16  \ft their…: Heb. their goings
forth\f*

All these were reckoned by genealogies in the days of Jotham
king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.

¶ The sons of Reuben, and the Gadites, and half the tribe of
